#Text=THE LOVE OF ULRICH NEBENDAHL
#Text=Perhaps of all , it troubled most the Herr Pfarrer .
#Text=Was he not the father of the village ?
#Text=And as such did it not fall to him to see his children marry well and suitably ?
#Text=marry in any case .
#Text=It was the duty of every worthy citizen to keep alive throughout the ages the sacred hearth fire , to rear up sturdy lads and honest lassies that would serve God , and the Fatherland .
#Text=A true son of Saxon soil was the Herr Pastor Winckelmann -- kindly , simple , sentimental .

#Text=" Why , at your age , Ulrich -- at your age , " repeated the Herr Pastor , setting down his beer and wiping with the back of his hand his large uneven lips , " I was the father of a family -- two boys and a girl .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The Herr Pfarrer sighed and hid his broad red face behind the raised cover of his pewter pot .

#Text= They must be good fun in a house , the little ones , " commented Ulrich , gazing upward with his dreamy eyes at the wreath of smoke ascending from his long-stemmed pipe .

column1: #Text=" The little ones , always my heart goes out to them . "
#Text=" Take to yourself a wife , " urged the Herr Pfarrer .
#Text=" It is your duty .

#Text=It would be pleasant to feel one was not working merely for oneself .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Elsa , now , " went on the Herr Pfarrer , " she is a good child , pious and economical .

#Text=Ulrich 's face lightened with a pleasant smile .

#Text= Aye , Elsa is a good girl , " he answered .

column1: #Text=" Her little hands -- have you ever noticed them , Herr Pastor -- so soft and dimpled . "
#Text=The Pfarrer pushed aside his empty pot and leaned his elbows on the table .
#Text=" I think -- I do not think -- she would say no .

#Text=The old pastor 's red face glowed redder , yet with pleasurable anticipation ; he was a born matchmaker .

#Text= It is Hedwig ; twice you walked home with her last week . "

column1: #Text=" It is a lonesome way for a timid maiden ; and there is the stream to cross , " explained the wheelwright .
#Text=For a moment the Herr Pastor 's face had clouded , but now it cleared again .
#Text=" Well , well , why not ?
#Text=" But you will ? "
#Text=Again there fell that troubled look into those dreamy eyes .
#Text=This time it was Ulrich who , laying aside his pipe , rested his great arms upon the wooden table .
#Text=" Now , how does a man know when he is in love ? " asked Ulrich of the Pastor who , having been married twice , should surely be experienced upon the point . "

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=How should he be sure that it is this woman and no other to whom his heart has gone out ?
